text: Bikkavolu is an Indian railway station in Bikkavolu, a village in East Godavari district of Andhra Pradesh. It lies on the Vijayawada-Chennai section and is administered under Vijayawada railway division of South Coast Railway zone. Eleven trains halt in this station every day. It is the 2140th-busiest station in the country. ==History== Between 1893 and 1896, of the East Coast State Railway, between Vijayawada and Cuttack was opened for traffic. The southern part of the East Coast State Railway (from Waltair to Vijayawada) was taken over by Madras Railway in 1901. == Classification == In terms of earnings and outward passengers handled, Bikkavolu is categorized as a Non- Subruban Grade-6 (NSG-6) railway station. Based on the re–categorization of Indian Railway stations for the period of 2017–18 and 2022–23, an NSG–6 category station earns nearly crore and handles close to passengers. == Important Persons == 1.Munta Phani Kumar 2.Thatholu Veerababu 3.Nelli Suresh == References == == External links == * Category:Railway stations in East Godavari district Category:Vijayawada railway division
title: Bikkavolu railway station
